Little darling, it’s been a long cold lonely winter

The winter of 1968 had been an especially brutal one in England, even by British standards. But besides the freezing winter, George was dealing with other issues as well. He had gone under surgery in early 1969, along with some family issues too. This included the fact that George learned his mother was suffering from serious cancer.

Source

Here comes the sun, doo da doo doo
 Here comes the sun, and I say
 It’s all right

This song was inspired by a time Harrison opted not to show up for a tedious Beatles business meeting—he told the BBC all about it:

It was just sunny and it was all just the release of that tension that had been building up on me. And it was just really nice sunny day. I picked up the guitar, which was the first time I’d played the guitar for a couple of weeks because I’d been so busy. And the first thing that came out was that song. It just came.
